intro: Melampyrum scardicum subsp. wettsteinii, commonly known as the Wettstein's touch-me-not, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. It produces small, yellowish-orange flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly different morphology compared to the main species, including variations in leaf shape and flower structure.
